benchmark_details.name: VideoGameBench
benchmark_details.overview: VideoGameBench is a benchmark consisting of 10 popular video games from the 1990s that vision-language models (VLMs) directly interact with in real-time to complete game objectives, without any game-specific scaffolding or auxiliary information.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the capabilities of vision-language models in completing complex video games and challenge their performance in real-time environments.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Limited to games from the 1990s, may not adequately represent modern gaming challenges.

data.source: Players and walkthrough data used to construct checkpoints for evaluation.
data.annotation: Data scraping from YouTube video walkthroughs for checkpoint detection.

methodology.calculation: Each game is scored based on the percentage of checkpoints reached against the total number of checkpoints.
methodology.interpretation: Scores represent the percentage of each game completed, with higher scores indicating better performance.
methodology.baseline_results: Gemini 2.5 Pro reached up to 0.48% on VideoGameBench.
methodology.validation: Games were manually verified by human players to ensure they can be completed.
